definition: to sound a bell/to raise the alarm
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: The end of term examinations and sounded the war drum.
sentences.chinese: 期末考試的戰鼓又敲響了。

sentences.english: Even the bell in Independence Hall was rung.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連獨立大廳的鐘也敲響了。

sentences.english: The clock tower affair has set the alarm bells ringing.
sentences.chinese: 今次天星鐘樓事件，爲港府吸納民意的機制敲響警鐘。

sentences.english: Ring the bell of the present, and you will hear the distant echoes of the infinite past and future.
sentences.chinese: 敲響當下的鐘，你會聽到遙遠的過去和未來的回聲。

sentences.english: Many old people like to pray when the New Year's bell rings.
sentences.chinese: 許多上年紀的老人都喜歡在新年鐘聲敲響那一刻祝告。

sentences.english: The New Year bell shall ring for the year of 2003.
sentences.chinese: 二00三年的新年鐘聲即將敲響。

sentences.english: The drums sounded and instead of following the commands, the girls simply giggled and blushed.
sentences.chinese: 戰鼓敲響了，但女孩們沒有服從命令，只是臉紅傻笑。

sentences.english: When such complaints arise in France's most sensitive industry -- nuclear power -- alarm bells start ringing.
sentences.chinese: 當法國最敏感的核能產業怨聲四起時，警鐘已經敲響。

sentences.english: Of this case adjudge also ring noisy alarm bell again to fictitious belongings malfeasant .
sentences.chinese: 此案的宣判也給虛擬財產犯罪者再次敲響警鐘。

sentences.english: Screams ring out as he jumps to slam the veranda doors safely shut.
sentences.chinese: 尖叫敲響當他跳關上游廊門安全地被關閉。

sentences.english: Aton told him by the stroke of midnight it would be over.
sentences.chinese: 艾頓告訴他午夜鐘聲敲響時會結束。

sentences.english: Strike up the drum and march courageously.

sentences.chinese: 一位法官敲響他的小木槌。

sentences.english: The phenomenon portrayed in the drawing is really thought- provoking and alarming.
sentences.chinese: 這一現象描繪的事情真的要引人深思並敲響警鐘。

sentences.english: But by the time he sounded the alarm, it may have been too late.
sentences.chinese: 但他腦子裏敲響警鐘的那一刻或許已經太遲。
